availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Indiana around 1836. Millett worked as a Clerk in Owensboro, Kentucky in 1860. He formed a state guard company in Owensboro for the State Guard of Kentucky, but later left with that company to Tennessee to join the Confederate Army. Millett was commissioned as Captain of Company K in the Fourth Regiment Kentucky Infantry, CSA on September 13, 1861. On November 19, 1863, he was promoted to Major. Millett fought at the battles of Shiloh, Vicksburg, Baton Rouge, Jackson, Chickamagua, Mission Ridge, Rocky Face Gap, Resaca and Dallas. Killed at the Battle of Dallas on May 28, 1864.

bibl.p: History of Daviess County, Kentucky (Chicago: Inter-State Publishing Co., 1883), 158; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess, District 1 Town of Owensboro, p. 955.
